Refresh.name: Refresh
Refresh.label: Refresh
Refresh.help: Manually refresh the lister. NOTE: This re-analyzes raw data for lister, so dynamically added lister data might disappear!

Editconfigcomp.name: Editconfigcomp
Editconfigcomp.label: Edit Config COMP
Editconfigcomp.help: Open a network editor window for the Lister's Config Component.

Editcoldefine.name: Editcoldefine
Editcoldefine.label: Edit Column Definitions
Editcoldefine.help: Open the lister's colDefine table. (Only available when Auto-define Columns is off)

Editcallbacks.name: Editcallbacks
Editcallbacks.label: Edit Callbacks
Editcallbacks.help: Open a text editor for the Lister's callbacks.

Printcallbacks.name: Printcallbacks
Printcallbacks.label: Print Callbacks
Printcallbacks.help: Enables debug prints of all callbacks (whether found or not) to the textport.

Inputtabledat.name: Inputtabledat
Inputtabledat.label: Input Table DAT
Inputtabledat.help: Table used as input to the lister. Wired input will override this.

Refreshoninputchange.name: Refreshoninputchange
Refreshoninputchange.label: Refresh On Input Change
Refreshoninputchange.help: When on, lister will be automatically refreshed when wired inputTable changes.

Inputtablehasheaders.name: Inputtablehasheaders
Inputtablehasheaders.label: Input Table Has Headers
Inputtablehasheaders.help: If True, the first row of the input table will be treated as column headers. For this to work, every column must have a non-blank header.

Autosyncinputtable.name: Autosyncinputtable
Autosyncinputtable.label: Auto-sync Input Table
Autosyncinputtable.enableExpr: me.par.Inputtabledat.eval() is not None and me.par.Inputtablehasheaders.eval()
Autosyncinputtable.help: If True, changes to the lister will be mirrored back to Input Table DAT automatically. This only works for columns with the following sourceDataModes: int, float, string, version, blank, color. Only available when Input Table DAT is defined via parameter and Input Table Has Headers is True.

Sourceindexinoutput.name: Sourceindexinoutput
Sourceindexinoutput.label: Source Index In Output
Sourceindexinoutput.help: If True, adds a column to the output DATs that holds the original index of the row data, from the input source. Useful for referring back to source tables after data is sorted or rearranged.

Autodefinecols.name: Autodefinecols
Autodefinecols.label: Auto-define Columns
Autodefinecols.help: Enables automatic generation of table columns.

Recreateautocolumns.name: Recreateautocolumns
Recreateautocolumns.label: Recreate Auto-columns
Recreateautocolumns.help: Re-analyzes raw data to create automatic column definitions. This will resize column widths, among other things.

Copyautocolstoconfig.name: Copyautocolstoconfig
Copyautocolstoconfig.label: Copy Auto Cols To Config
Copyautocolstoconfig.help: Pressing this button copies the column settings created by Autodefine Columns into the lister's custom colDefine table. This is useful for creating a starting point based on Autodefine settings. WARNING: this will destroy all current custom column settings.

Multiplerowselect.name: Multiplerowselect
Multiplerowselect.label: Multiple Row Select
Multiplerowselect.help: Enables selection of multiple rows using shift and ctrl keys. Only available when Selectable Rows is on.

Dragtoreorderrows.name: Dragtoreorderrows
Dragtoreorderrows.label: Drag To Reorder Rows
Dragtoreorderrows.help: Enables drag to reorder feature. Only available when Selectable Rows is on (rows must be selected to reorder).

Arrowkeys.name: Arrowkeys
Arrowkeys.label: Arrow Keys
Arrowkeys.help: Enables moving the row selection using arrow keys. Only available when Selectable Rows is on.

Deletekey.name: Deletekey
Deletekey.label: Delete Key
Deletekey.help: Enables selected row deletion using Delete key. Only available when Selectable Rows is on.

Highlightrollover.name: Highlightrollover
Highlightrollover.label: Highlight Rollover
Highlightrollover.help: When on, rows will be highlighted when rolled over with the mouse. See Config Component inside for highlight colors.

Drophighlight.name: Drophighlight
Drophighlight.label: Drop Highlight
Drophighlight.help: Defines preview when an external object is dragged into lister and defined as an acceptable drop (see onDropHover callback in Basic Callbacks). The color of the line or highlight will be defined by the dragDropLineColor or dragDropOverlayColor rows in the define table, respectively.

Sortcols.name: Sortcols
Sortcols.label: Sort Columns
Sortcols.help: A space delimited list of columns to sort by. Note that this is set automatically when Clickable Header is set to True.

Sortreverse.name: Sortreverse
Sortreverse.label: Sort Reverse
Sortreverse.help: When True, sort order is reversed.

Filtercols.name: Filtercols
Filtercols.label: Filter Columns
Filtercols.help: A space delimited list of columns to apply the filter to. If this is blank, no filter will be applied.

Filterstring.name: Filterstring
Filterstring.label: Filter String
Filterstring.help: In order to be displayed, rows must contain the filter string in one or more of the filter columns.

Selectedrows.name: Selectedrows
Selectedrows.label: Selected Rows
Selectedrows.help: Always contains a space delimited list of the currently selected rows.

Selectedoutput.name: Selectedoutput
Selectedoutput.label: Selected Output
Selectedoutput.help: Determines contents of the out_selected component output.

Savesort.name: Savesort
Savesort.label: Save Sort
Savesort.help: If True, save sort state between loads and when copying/cutting/pasting component.

Savefilter.name: Savefilter
Savefilter.label: Save Filter
Savefilter.help: If True, save filter state between loads and when copying/cutting/pasting component.

Saveselectedrows.name: Saveselectedrows
Saveselectedrows.label: Save Selected Rows
Saveselectedrows.help: If True, save selection state between loads and when copying/cutting/pasting component.

Usesortindicatorchars.name: Usesortindicatorchars
Usesortindicatorchars.label: Use Sort Indicator Chars
Usesortindicatorchars.help: If True, display the following characters in sorted column headers to indicate sort direction

Sortchar.name: Sortchar
Sortchar.label: Sort Char
Sortchar.help: If list is sorted by a column, display this in column header after label

Sortreversechar.name: Sortreversechar
Sortreversechar.label: Sort Reverse Char
Sortreversechar.help: If list is reverse sorted by a column, display this in column header after label

Allowundo.name: Allowundo
Allowundo.label: Allow Undo
Allowundo.help: Enables Undo features when user edits cells and moves rows.

Advancedcallbacks.name: Advancedcallbacks
Advancedcallbacks.label: Do Advanced Callbacks
Advancedcallbacks.help: Enables advanced callback features. See inside the internal Docs component for more information.

Rawdata.name: Rawdata
Rawdata.label: Raw Data
Rawdata.help: This is a versatile parameter that can be either contain a path to a tableDAT containing data for the Lister, a python list, a python list of lists, or a python list of dictionaries. Useful for testing different kinds of input.

Linkedtable.name: Linkedtable
Linkedtable.label: Linked Table DAT
Linkedtable.help: The lister's contents will be locked to the contents of this DAT. Changes to the DAT will be reflected in Lister and vice-versa.

Lockconfigs.name: Lockconfigs
Lockconfigs.label: Lock Configs
Lockconfigs.help: Turn off to allow changes to the following two parameters...

Configcomp.name: Configcomp
Configcomp.label: Config Comp
Configcomp.help: The Lister's Config Component containing format information.

Callbackdat.name: Callbackdat
Callbackdat.label: Callback DAT
Callbackdat.help: The DAT containing the Lister's custom callbacks. Normally this is located in the Config Component.
